symbol.name: N_spectrum
symbol.doc: Size of the wavelength array for which the refractive index of the material is given.

symbol.name: N_spectrum_coating
symbol.doc: Size of the wavelength array for which the refractive index of the coating is given.

symbol.name: N_spectrum_RT
symbol.doc: Size of the wavelength array for which the reflectance or transmission of the lens is given.

field.name: type
field.doc: Type of the lens (e.g. concave, convex etc.).

field.name: other_type
field.doc: If you chose 'other' as type specify what it is.

group.name: substrate
group.doc: Properties of the substrate material of the lens. If the lens has a coating specify the coating material and its properties in 'coating'.

field.name: substrate_material
field.doc: Specify the substrate material of the lens.

field.name: substrate_thickness
field.doc: Thickness of the lens substrate at the optical axis.

field.name: index_of_refraction
field.doc: Complex index of refraction of the lens material. Specify at given wavelength (or energy, wavenumber etc.) values.

group.name: COATING
group.doc: If the lens has a coating describe the material and its properties. Some basic information can be found e.g. [here] (https://www.opto-e.com/basics/reflection-transmission-and-coatings). If the back and front side of the lens are coated with different materials, use separate COATING(NXsample) fields to describe the coatings on the front and back side, respectively. For example: coating_front(NXsample) and coating_back(NXsample).

field.name: coating_type
field.doc: Specify the coating type (e.g. dielectric, anti-reflection (AR), multilayer coating etc.).

field.name: index_of_refraction_coating
field.doc: Complex index of refraction of the coating. Specify at given spectral values (wavelength, energy, wavenumber etc.).

field.name: reflectance
field.doc: Reflectance of the lens at given spectral values.

field.name: transmission
field.doc: Transmission of the lens at given spectral values.

field.name: focal_length
field.doc: Focal length of the lens on the front side (first value), i.e. where the beam is incident, and on the back side (second value).

field.name: curvature_radius_FACE
field.doc: Curvature radius of the lens. Instead of 'FACE' in the name of this field, the user is advised to specify for which surface (e.g. front or back) the curvature is provided: e.g. curvature_front or curvature_back. The front face is the surface on which the light beam is incident, while the back face is the one from which the light beam exits the lens.

field.name: Abbe_number
field.doc: Abbe number (or V-number) of the lens.
